title: Search in parent folders for node module resolution
body:
Replaces my previous PR #79651 by implementing [recommendations](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/78894#issuecomment-535254539) from @octref on #78894 .

Further to #70693 which was reworked by @aeschli  in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/8f7293470661319099bdda43eecc386a43c87189 due to issues with require.resolve and webpack.

- Fixes #78894
- Fixes microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice#136

The current implementation for microsoft/vscode-css-languageservice#136 resolves the path to a CSS module but only looks for node_modules in the same folder as the CSS file, which for many use cases is not sufficient.

This PR updates `resolvePathToModule` so that it looks in parent folders for the existence of `node_modules/module-name` all the way up to the workspace root, following node module resolution.

Alternative approaches were raised in #79651 and this approach was preferred by @octref in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/78894#issuecomment-535254539.

![Screenshot 2019-08-23 at 16 18 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1027024/63603607-e140ef80-c5c1-11e9-89b7-755a7b6710f4.png)
![Screenshot 2019-08-23 at 16 19 48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1027024/63603608-e140ef80-c5c1-11e9-87b7-12e6febc7f14.png)

title: Autohide minimap for frames that already show all the code

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Right now, the minimap is shown in every frame when it's enabled. I'd like for it to automatically hide when everything can be seen already, or alternatively to be able to disable it per-file instead of globally.

title: VSCode exit hangs W10
body:
- VSCode Version: all 
- OS Version: W10x64 1903

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Visual Studio code
2. Close Visual Studio code

Additional informations:
- installed Slack, Webex
Before 1903 there was not any similar issues. 
System seems to be working, after VSCode exit iam unable to run new webbrowser page, ping any ip adress etc. or open new application. System itself it working.
Problem entountered on many devices in my company. 
Devices in domain, InTune in use. Main antywirus ms defender.
Hardware: Lenovo laptops. 


Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
Does this issue occur when GPU disabled from shortcut?: Yes
Does this issue occur when telemetry disabled?: Yes
Does this issue occur when git disabled?: Yes

title: Feature request: tree view in open editors

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Currently open editors seems to be a flat list of opened files.

I would like to see this list as tree view which would be a subset of the tree view in the opened folder (or workspace). The sorting should be exactly the same as in the full tree view. I did not find an option to do this.

It would look something like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/600821/65761493-2a371700-e11f-11e9-9d0f-9b2a85502225.png)

title: Show keyboard shortcuts inside integrated terminal in Screencast Mode
body:
I really like the option of showing Only Keyboard Shortcuts in Screencast Mode.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/872762/65753993-bfd9a300-e12d-11e9-9ab1-f4a953ef093d.png)

But then, Inside the terminal it ignores the shortcuts (Screencast Mode). The shortcuts are showing inside terminal only when `Screencat Mode: Only Keyboard Shortcuts` is unchecked. 

Add the ability to show keyboard shortcuts terminal when the `Screencat Mode: Only Keyboard Shortcuts` are checked.

title: Adding basic save service
Extract save / dirty service
body:
### Problem

As part of our custom editor exploration (#77131) I believe that we'll need to extract a service that handles saving resources. Currently this is implemented by `ITextFileService`

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/a3420f633e502289891361a071cf3aceb20c6360/src/vs/workbench/services/textfile/common/textfiles.ts#L65

However it is not clear to me how we can hook custom editors into our `ITextFileService` with out a lot of hacks. We specifically want the file `save`, `save as`, and `save all`  commands to be able to work for writable custom editors

### Proposal
Based on @bpasero's feedback, I propose we introduce a new service called something like `ISaveService` that would have the following functionality:

- Get dirty resources
- Tell if a resource is dirty or not
- Save resources

`ISaveService` would delegate to `ITextFileService` for normal resources, but should also allow our custom editor service to hook into save. As a first step, this service would probably absorb the `save` and `doSave` methods in `fileCommands.ts`:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/0796f42a7d5327648eaed2db2f39ae9e9342e005/src/vs/workbench/contrib/files/browser/fileCommands.ts#L106

title: ctrl + click "go to definition" clashes with ctrl + click "follow link"
body:
@AngusWR commented on [Wed Sep 25 2019](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-python/issues/7591)


## Environment data

- VS Code version: Version: 1.38.1
- Extension version (available under the Extensions sidebar): Version: 2019.9.34911
- OS and version: Windows 10 Pro 1903 18362.356
- Python version (& distribution if applicable, e.g. Anaconda): 3.6.7

## Expected behaviour

ctrl + click on a string representation of a url opens the url in chrome

## Actual behaviour

ctrl + click on a string representation of a url opens the url in chrome and also goes to the definition for str in builtins.pyi


Holding ctrl and hovering the url:

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46464807/65584584-73bf1f00-dfc4-11e9-8d43-c1e5aa92735f.jpg)



After clicking the url

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46464807/65584596-76ba0f80-dfc4-11e9-899d-f50b3af833b7.jpg)


I haven't been able to find a way of changing the key binding for the "go to definition" feature. Any advice?

---

@karrtikr commented on [Thu Sep 26 2019](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-python/issues/7591#issuecomment-535717671)

For changing keybindings, go to `File` -> `Preferences` -> `Keyboard shortcuts`. Search for `Go to definition`.
Anyways, this is controlled by VSCode, not the extension. So I am transferring the issue.

title: TS file watching busted with Electron 6
body:
Tracks the VS Code side of https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/33564

**Repo**
On MacOS with VS Code insiders

For the project:

`tsconfig.js`
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "module": "commonjs",
        "target": "es2016",
        "jsx": "react"
    }
}
```

`src/main.ts`
```ts
export function foo() {
    add
}
```

1. Open main.ts
1. Create a new file `src/add.ts` in VS Code
```ts
export function add() { }
```

1. Back in `main.ts`, try auto importing `add`

    🐛 Doesn't show up

1. In `add`, run the `TypeScript: Go to project configuration` command. This should open the `tsconfig.json`

    🐛 File is not part of any project


**Investigation**
Something seems busted with using any version of TypeScript + Electron 6 on MacOS. I've tested the following cases so far:

- MacOS, newest TS with VS Code Stable — ✅ works
- MacOS, stable TS with VS Code Stable — ✅ works
- MacOS, stable TS with VS Code insides — ❌ broken
- MacOS, newest TS with VS Code insides — ❌ broken
- MacOS, TS 3.3 (an old version) with VS Code insiders — ❌ broken
- Windows, any TS with VS Code Insiders — ✅ works

Behind the scenes, TS uses node's `fs.watch` by default so I suspect the bug is somewhere with that not firing events properly

As @RyanCavanaugh and @sheetalkamat brought up, we cannot fix this on the TS side old TS versions are also broken

title: Negative patterns in exclude settings
body:
Issue Type: Bug The search indexer (ripgrep?) seems to index the entire project before performing a search even if the "files to include" option excludes 99% of the file tree. After indexing is complete, search results are nearly instant, but the index seems to be invalidated at least a couple times a day (I'm not sure what the mechanism is). Our codebase at work contains at least 10k files, and performing a global search on it literally slows my mouse down if the index has to be rebuilt. Would it be feasible/faster to glob the "files to include" option first, build a list of files to search, then search only those files? If not, is there something I can do to prevent the index from being invalidated so often? VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

title: Allow extensions to determine if a position is within a fold

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
This has been the most demanded feature of VSCodeVim: [VSCodeVim/Vim#1004](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/1004) for over 3 years.

The main problem with Folds and Vim is that some motions will skip right over folded areas (like moving up/down). We need to know if we are in a folded area so we can iterate these motions until we are out of the fold.

An API like ``vscode.window.activeTextEditor.getAllFoldedRegions(): vscode.Range[]`` would be ideal.

An API like ``vscode.window.activeTextEditor.isPositionInFold(position: vscode.Position): boolean`` would also be great.

* * *

This is technically a duplicate for [22276](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/22276), but that was closed because the roadmap at the time couldn't include this ticket.

Maybe it's time to revisit this? It has been blocking the most demanded feature of one of the most popular plugins out there, for 3+ years.

title: Add tasks to user configuration
body: Part of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/1435

title: Show editor icons into a separate row below the editor title area
body:
It may be that I'm getting old, but it's utterly hard for me to tell a tab's icons, belonging to a tab, from the program's icons if the tab's icons are not shown within the tab content container. ![Diff 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/65695052-189a3480-e077-11e9-8065-07c51f8bf813.png)
So, often when I'd intend to close a tab using the mouse, I actually close Visual Studio Code, because from the glimpse of an eye that's the only visible "X" near the top of the tab's belongings: ![Diff 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/65692183-695b5e80-e072-11e9-8107-fc1d194526c2.png)
Moreover, Visual Studio Code doesn't ask for confirmation to close although there are running tasks currently performing some work. So, things are getting aborted which should actually not be.
### That's why I'd like to propose to revise the currently unclear layout by: 1. adding an ever visible close button ("X") to a tab (see #66642), 1. moving a tab's icons into the tab's content area by creating a second inner icon container panel above the content container panel within the tab's content area, 1. lighten the tab header row background color to give better contrast to tab headers, 1. adding a confirmation dialog to Visual Studio Code before closing the program when there are any running tasks. ### The desired layout would resemble this: ![Diff 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/65694292-e936f800-e075-11e9-8b73-2e60b555b0ff.png)

title: Web: implement browser extension debug service properly
body:
Currently https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/contrib/debug/browser/extensionHostDebugService.ts is bypassing the host API and uses `window.open` to open a extension host debug window. Instead, we need to make sure to pass this on to the embedder. 

(not critical for September, but wanted to set the milestone to have it "on deck")

Ubuntu, VSCode v1.38.1

Environment variables set in launch.json cannot be referenced through ${env:...} in launch.json.

I.e., the following doesn't work:

environment: [
  { "name": "ROOT", "value": "${WorkspaceFolder}" },
  { "name": "EXT", "value": "${env:ROOT}/extensions" },
  { "name": "PATH", "value": "${env:ROOT}/bin:${env:EXT}/bin:${env:PATH}" },
]

results in PATH being set to:

/bin:/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/bin:/usr/local/bin:/snap/bin

title: Untangle electron parts from update contribution
body:
Most of the pieces in `src/vs/workbench/contrib/update/browser/update.ts` are useful in the web as well, but there is one dependency to the Electron window ID that we should take out to a `electron-browser` only piece. 

I pushed https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/commit/156b5fd4f55acf12dc89506331f969d4c46fd2c4 to adopt a new `IElectronEnvironmentService` that carries this ID. Ideally we could move that piece out.

title: [Bug] Naming of vscode Components vscode-server vscode-remote

This project will need a additional server to serve vscode-web at present vscode-remote is called vscode-server as binary it should get renamed to vscode-remote so we can call the server that serves vscode-web vscode-server

also in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/master/.gitignore src/vs/server is ignored which leads me to the suggestion that @bpasero is using that also for his current server implamentation he should consider joining issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81474

Until this is discussed and solved we will process with vscode-web-server

title: Lazy Filer Explorer
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Can we have a lazy watcher? i.e. it only scans the files directly under the current dir and does not go recursively and it would be invoked to scan once we open a dir in file explorer.

The reason is that we usually have tons of file in a project and also soft-link to other projects that can potentially create loops. And I notice that file scanning really cause vscode to consume too much CPU and mem at the starting. 
Hence, while I do NOT want to exclude those folders as I occasionally need to dig into them to see if things are alright, I really want to have an option to keep vscode from crazily scanning my file systems and from freezing the system every time vscode is started.

title: Bad behavior with limited internet connection
body:
Issue Type: Bug When starting vscode with limited internet connection (for instance with an active VPN connection to a company network, which limits access to certain hosts) vscode does not initialize fully (probably the update queries hang). This is especially a problem when launching a extension debug session. In this case the extension is never fully initialized and an error appears after 10 seconds. Additionally, after closing the debug instance of vscode the debug session is not closed and I have to manually stop it. title: shows incorrect current branch in status bar untill restart
body:
Have Multiple branch switch between them, It stuck into showing the last branch even though the branch is already switched to another.
On restart the IDE it switches and starts showing the correct branch.

title: Debug: Console feels janky on high frequency output
body: Running our selfhost unit tests seems much slower than running it in a terminal. Hypothesis: tree isn't performing well enough for this scenario. We might need a specialized tree API for this.

title: Support clipboard list so you can paste one of the latest X items
body:
Similar to a feature on JetBrains products, CTRL + SHIFT + V displays a list of items on your clipboard (recent items) that you can then, select which one you want to paste.

This is extremely useful and increase productivity. Yes I know that copy / paste can and probably will bring you some issues, but some times, you are moving stuff around and having the chance to select which item to paste from a list of recent items on the clipboard is awesome.

title: Compact menu: make hiding more discoverable
body:
Should maybe show an entry in the menu to hide the compact menu:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/65668958-fbe40980-e042-11e9-91b6-7c373bcbcedd.png)
